definition: to despise/to disdain/to look down upon
a ranking of items in a particular category, with the most highly regarded on top (neologism c. 2012, coined by analogy with 食物鏈|食物链[shi2 wu4 lian4], food chain)

sentences.english: A good man should disdain flatterers.
The miser was despised by everyone in the city.
sentences.chinese: 這個守財奴受到城市裏每個人的鄙視。

sentences.english: Those whom sports writers most despise, they first overrate.
sentences.chinese: 對那些最鄙視的人，足球記者總是先開始誇張。

sentences.english: "You're a dwarf, " Young Griff said scornfully.
sentences.chinese: “你是個侏儒，”小格里夫鄙視的說。

sentences.english: He disdained that man for snobbishness and was unwilling to talk to him.
sentences.chinese: 他鄙視那個勢利小人，不願和他說話。

sentences.english: Niu is such a hypocritical man that he is being disguised by many people on the internet.
sentences.chinese: 牛根生是如此虛僞的一個人，網上很多人都鄙視他。

sentences.english: Never use the terms “filthy lucre” or “I despise money.”
sentences.chinese: 永遠不要使用詞語“不義之財”或“我鄙視金錢。”

sentences.english: It is lucky that those who despise it in a cap revere it in a hat.
sentences.chinese: 幸而鄙視紅帽子的人也還崇拜紅法冠呢。

sentences.english: He who bribes is to be despised.
And of course, I have zero respect for thieves.
sentences.chinese: 當然了，我也鄙視抄書行爲。

sentences.english: I despised myself and the voices of my accursed human education.
sentences.chinese: 我鄙視自己，鄙視身上那些可惡的人類教育的聲音。

sentences.english: I despised myself and the voices of my accursed human education.
sentences.chinese: 我鄙視自己，鄙視身上那些可惡的人類教育的聲音。

sentences.english: I’ll go on the record as saying that I truly despise the annual performance review process.
sentences.chinese: 不怕明講，我真的很鄙視年度績效考覈流程。

sentences.english: They have a great contempt for conventionality.
The tone of voice people used was belittling and self-righteous.
sentences.chinese: 人們說話語氣鄙視而自以爲是。

sentences.english: Ageism is a form of discrimination.
